intro: Mundia brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian star apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, star-shaped white flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that are edible and have a mild, sweet flavor. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in tropical regions.
